titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation commanding all debts, rents, and mony whatsoever, owing unto prsons that are in rebellion against His Majesty, or residing in places where garrisons are kept without commission from His Majesty, to be brought into His Majesties receipt at Oxford.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: by Leonard Lichfield, printer to the University,

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: Given at our court at Oxford this tenth day of December, in the nineteenth yeare of Our raigne. 1643.
Arms 37; Steele notation: wayes power yeare.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
